answers.answer: hi,you are suffering from paraesthesia. There can be several causes like diabetes, hypothyroidism, vitamin deficiency, alcoholism. Some anticonvulsant drugs can also cause paraesthesia. I suggest you consult your physician as soon as you can.

Hi,Yes you probably suffering from paraesthesia due to pressure effects on nerves, what is the duration of your symptoms, are you under any medication, stress can make it worse. better to meet your family doctor and get investigated. you can have more info at this URLhttp://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/bhcv2/bhcarticles.nsf/pages/Pins_and_needles?OpenDocument
You should try a reflexology treatment. It is very good for the nerves.

question: I get this Pins and needle vibration throughout my whole body when I sleep. It payralizes me and I am unable to move. WHat can I do
title: Pins and needles preventing me to sleep.
